Name: Dataset: Comparing urban coastal flood risk in 136 cities under RCP2.6, 4.5, 8.5 and a high-end SLR scenario
Short description: The dataset contains sea-level rise projections, expected damages and risk data for RCP4.5 and RCP2.6 additionally to the RCP8.5 and the High-end scenario
Model type/method:
Geometric Brownian Model for stochastic analysis of damages.
SLR modelling
Keywords: Regional sea-level rise, Probabilistic projections, Coastal cities, Damage risk, Ice-sheet melting risk, Unmitigated scenarios
Variables and units:
Damages (US$)
Risk measures (VaR, ES, in US$)
SLR (cm)
Recommended citation: Abadie, Luis M., Jackson, Luke P., Sainz de Murieta, Elisa, Jevrejeva, Svetlana, & Galarraga, Ibon. (2021). Additional dataset to "Comparing urban coastal flood risk in 136 cities under two alternative sea-level projections: RCP 8.5 and an expert opinion-based high-end scenario" [Data set]. Zenodo. https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.4733499

Name: Risk measures and the distribution of damage curves for 600 European coastal cities
Short description: Using a dataset of probabilistic sea-level rise and other of flood damages and protection cost curves for the 600 largest European coastal cities, stochastic damage curves and their distributions are calculated, with and without adaptation.
Model type/method: Generalized Extreme Value (GEV) dis- tribution model
Keywords: sea level rise, risk measures, costs, adaptation in cities, Europe
Variables and units:
Damages and adaptation costs  (US$)
Risk measures (VaR, ES, in US$)
SLR (cm)
Recommended citation: Abadie, L.M., Galarraga, I., Markandya, A., Sainz de Murieta, E., 2019. Risk measures and the distribution of damage curves for 600 European coastal cities. Environmental Research Letters 14, 064021. https://doi.org/10.1088/1748-9326/ab185c
Other comments: The dataset is published as the supplementary material to the article.
